segments.en: Linked Discourses 8
1. With Vaṅgīsa
3. Good-Hearted

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā vaṅgīso āḷaviyaṃ viharati aggāḷave cetiye āyasmatā nigrodhakappena upajjhāyena saddhiṃ.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Vaṅgīsa was staying near Āḷavī, at the Aggāḷava Tree-shrine, together with his mentor, Venerable Nigrodhakappa.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā vaṅgīso attano paṭibhānena aññe pesale bhikkhū atimaññati.
segments.en: Now at that time Venerable Vaṅgīsa looked down on other good-hearted mendicants because of his own poetic virtuosity.
Then he thought,

segments.pli: “alābhā vata me, na vata me lābhā; dulladdhaṃ vata me, na vata me suladdhaṃ;
segments.en: “It’s my loss, my misfortune,

segments.pli: yvāhaṃ attano paṭibhānena aññe pesale bhikkhū atimaññāmī”ti.
segments.en: that I look down on other good-hearted mendicants because of my own poetic virtuosity.”

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā vaṅgīso attanāva attano vippaṭisāraṃ uppādetvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imā gāthāyo abhāsi:
segments.en: Then, on the occasion of arousing remorse in himself, he recited these verses:
“Give up conceit, Gotama!
Completely abandon the different kinds of conceit!
Besotted with the different kinds of conceit,
you’ve had regrets for a long time.
Smeared by smears and slain by conceit,
people fall into hell.
When people slain by conceit are reborn in hell,
they grieve for a long time.
But a mendicant who practices rightly,
owning the path, never grieves.
They enjoy happiness and a good reputation,
and they rightly call him a ‘Seer of Truth’.
So don’t be hard-hearted, be energetic,
with hindrances given up, be pure.
Then with conceit given up completely,
use knowledge to make an end, and be at peace.”

sections.title: At one time Venerable Vaṅgīsa was staying near Āḷavī,…

suttaplex.blurb: As a renowned poet, Vaṅgīsa looked down on less skilled mendicants. Ashamed of his conceit, he exhorted himself in verse to be humble and at peace.
